critique: The document is an executive order focused on telecommunications policy. As the President, the primary emotions I want to elicit are a sense of confidence in the government's ability to manage telecommunications effectively and a sense of security knowing that national security and emergency preparedness are being addressed. There might also be a desire to convey a sense of progress and innovation in telecommunications. However, the tone is formal and bureaucratic, so strong emotional responses are unlikely. I will start with initial scores and then revise them after further consideration.
